alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 1:52AM AKST until March 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with periods of low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility one mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...From noon Wednesday to 6 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will develop Wednesday afternoon and continue through Thursday evening. The strongest winds and worst conditions are expected on Wednesday night through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
